meanings.definition: Meandering - winding or turning in a zigzag course
meanings.sent1: The river followed a meandrous path through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The meandrous road led us through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The meandrous stream seemed to enjoy taking its time through the meadow.
meanings.sent4: Her meandrous thoughts wandered from one topic to another.
meanings.sent5: The meandrous pattern of the maze made it challenging to find the way out.

meanings.definition: Meandered - moved slowly in a winding or turning course
meanings.sent1: The hiker meandered along the meandrous trail, enjoying the scenery.
meanings.sent2: She meandered through the park, lost in her thoughts.
meanings.sent3: The cat meandered lazily around the yard, chasing butterflies.
meanings.sent4: The conversation meandered from topic to topic, never staying on one for long.
meanings.sent5: The river meandered gently through the meandrous landscape.

meanings.definition: Meanders - winding or turning paths or courses
meanings.sent1: The map showed the meanders of the river as it flowed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: We followed the meanders of the hiking trail, enjoying the scenic views.
meanings.sent3: The meanders of the labyrinth confused the adventurers trying to escape.
meanings.sent4: The meanders of her handwriting made it difficult to read the letter.
meanings.sent5: The meanders of the dance floor allowed for intricate footwork during the performance.
